msDesc.head: Walter Burley, commentaries on Aristotle; herbal

supportDesc.extent: Fols. ii (numbered fols. ii-iii) + 141 + i (numbered fol. iv). 245 170

binding.p: A modern replacement. Sewn on five thongs. The front pastedown has a mark left by a chain-staple in Watson’s position 6. At the front, two medieval vellum flyleaves; at the rear, one modern paper leaf (iv).

history.provenance: ‘Hunc librum dedit Frater Thomas Besford’ Rad’ fratribus claustralibus ad studendum quem qui alienauit vel fraudem de eo fecit uel uiolauerit anathema sit In hoc uolumine continentur isti libri videlicet Problemata aristotilis Item liber metherorum Item de celo mundo Item quidem tractatus de phisica [added: videlicet de stillacione aquarum Item de zucra Rosacea]’ (fol. i, a piece of vellum once pasted down, now inserted loose in the front of the book; s. xiv ex., the additions s. xv). Unknown to Ker, MLGB and Watson’s Supplement, but identified and discussed by Coates from information supplied by M.B. Parkes; see 99–100, 104, 165. Besford also gave Reading a copy of Robert Holcot’s Wisdom commentary, now BL, MS Royal 4 C.vi.
history.acquisition: ‘Liber Colegij Sancti Joannis Baptistae Oxon Ex dono Magistri Joannis Stonor generosi de Northstoke in Comitatu Oxon’ (fol. iiiv, upper margin).

msItem.note: A rejected leaf, the equivalent of the current fol. 49 but spaced to fill the entire leaf, with the end of item 1 below. Written in anglicana in a secretary duct (no secretary letter forms), s. xv, by the hand responsible for quire 4. The correspondence of fols. iii and 49 suggests a superseded fascicle boundary. Fol. iii would have been a singleton bearing the end of text 1 and of a booklet. The leaf would have become expendable and would have been replaced when the decision was made to continue the first booklet by adding text 2.

msItem.explicit: formam et naturam alicuius re tunc scimus principium motus eiusdem rei etc. Quoddam
msItem.author: WALTER BURLEY
msItem.title: Expositio libri Meteororum
msItem.note: Lohr, no. 26, Traditio 24 (1968), 182 (Sharpe 717). Only six lines on fol. 60, the remainder blank, but fol. 60v bounded. At the head, a 9-line space for a rubric, unfilled; but the title, ‘Liber metheterorum’, added later (fol. 50, upper margin) and appears as a running title throughout. The text includes a series of diagrams, the space for one (fol. 56va) unfilled.

msItem.author: WALTER BURLEY
msItem.title: Expositio libri De caelo et mundo
msItem.note: Lohr, no. 21 at 181 as above, this MS noted (Sharpe 716). Only three lines of text on fol. 119vb; fol. 120 is blank, but the recto is bounded and ruled and the verso bounded.

collation.catchwords: In the first booklet, two catchwords, under the inner column, but routinely matching letters (a–d) on the last versos and first rectos of quires to keep the text in order.
collation.signatures: In three quires, all leaves in the first half signed, variously: with roman numerals (quire 5), by the opening with letters (quire 2), and with both letters and roman numerals (quire 1). In the second booklet, boxed catchwords under the gutter columns; all leaves in the first half of each quire are signed with roman numerals.

layoutDesc.layout:
In double columns, each column
193 60 , with 13 mm between columns, in 46 lines to the column (some variation). No prickings; bounded and ruled in brown and black ink.

handDesc.handNote: Written in anglicana, s. xv in. (more than one hand: recognizable bounds to stints at quire ends 36/37, 48/49, but there are others; item 3 by a single scribe). Punctuation by medial point and double virgula (perhaps unexecuted signals for a paraph).

decoDesc.decoNote: Booklet 1: 3-line blue lombards on red flourishing at textual divisions; alternate blue and red paraphs to break up the text.
Booklet 2: 3-line spaces left for medial capitals with guide letters.

msContents.textLang: Latin, with glosses in Middle English

msItem.incipit: Arnoglossa id est plantago frigida est et sicca cuius aqua bene distillata uulnera desiccat
msItem.explicit: demones ab hominibus fugat sanat sciaticam passionem quadraginta diebus cotinuis continuis bibita
msItem.title: An alphabetical herbal, ending with ‘Ypericon’
msItem.note: (eTK 0141L, the only other text cited BL, MS Sloane 382, fols. 188v–90v). Although ‘plantago’ is not, the glosses to plants named are customarily in English. Fols. 139v–41v were originally blank.

msItem.incipit: Nota zucra rosacea sit bene fieri decet primo antequam folia rubea rosatea sint expansa collige

msItem.title: A series of medical notes, ending with recipes using rosewater
msItem.note: In a hand similar to that of the main text, which has written recipe material into some earlier blanks, e.g. fol. 136.

supportDesc.collation: 1112 1212 (–10, –11, –12; probably all blank, and two of them stubs following fol. 141). No catchwords or signatures.

layoutDesc.layout: In long lines, 26 lines to the page. No prickings; bounded and ruled in lead, the rules washed.

handDesc.handNote: Written in gothic textura quadrata, s. xv in. Punctuation by occasional medial point.

decoDesc.decoNote: Two-line blue lombards on red flourishing at the head of each alphabetical section; other entries marked with red and blue 1-line lombards. Blank leaves left between alphabetical sections.
